title: make (re)run provide some informative logging at INFO level on what is going on
body:
probably the same issue of the status as #3342  but I thought that it might be some "dirty" check or smth like that which could be improved and we could also improve logging

FWIW -- `git status` takes about 2 sec to report that there is no changes.

I am trying to rerun some previous commit (run record has no `inputs` or `outputs` since I cannot afford all the waiting for checking presence and unlocking, see #3162 for possible assistance there), and without `-l debug` it just hangs there for a while without **any** INFO msg on what is going on.  So here is the beginning from running it with `-l debug`  and I need to go can not wait for any follow up lines. And even with `-l debug` there is no clear idea on what is going on -- is it checking that we are not dirty? or something else?

```shell
$ date; DATALAD_LOG_TIMESTAMP=1 datalad -l debug rerun 0b43e17e87842c6e17b79dbb87a7b52abe8a335c    
Sat Aug  3 12:08:42 EDT 2019

52abe8a335c']
```

datalad 0.12.0rc4-311-gf833c282
